stories.title: Twitter adds edit button for everyone except you

stories.text:
Looking for an app/application/API that builds chronology. There are many "timeline" apps that are graphical-centric (i.e. making nice looking timelines). Also there are "project management" apps which present similar concepts constrained within the view of completing a project.

But I am looking for a lower level data-centric API or app. It should provide a way to log chronological events with a time, location, and attendees (and other dependencies). From there a logic of chronological flow can be established from one event to another. Any recommendations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Chronology API?

stories.text:
Can anyone recommend resources to facilitate fasting beyond the standard 8/16/8 method?

Specifically, for longer-term fasting cycles (E.g. religious fasting periods)?
stories.title: Ask HN: Fasting Resources?
The Ancient Technologists Who Changed Everything

stories.text: Hi All. I need any tips about a technical interview process of prospective employee. I always was on the different side of the table, however currently I need to do the interview from different side. Could anyone give me hints, tips or any proper guide how to find a good developer. The role that I need to fulfill is a junior position, basically I need a person who wants to learn and eager for knowledge.
stories.title: Technical Interview Prospective Employee
